business.headline: Sensex, Nifty closing: Top stocks that gained and lost on BSE, NSEIT and auto sector stocks dragged the market down. The fall in IT and auto stocks is linked to concerns over US reciprocal tariffs, which are set to come into effect on April 2.

Thailand stock exchange halts trading after earthquake hits MyanmarFollowing tremors from the Myanmar earthquake, the Stock Exchange of Thailand suspended all trading for the Friday afternoon session.

DA hiked by 2%: Here's how much central government employees will earn nowWith the 2% hike, DA has now risen from 53% to 55%. Pensioners will also experience a similar increase in their Dearness Relief (DR).

Sensex, Nifty end FY25 on a weak note as Trump tariffs weigh on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 191.51 points to close at 77,414.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 72.60 points to end at 23,519.35.

How India saw a billionaire boom in just 10 yearsIndia's billionaire club isn't just growing—it's thriving. A decade ago, cracking this list was a rare feat. Now, it's happening faster than ever. Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.
Missed TDS on rent? Here's what tax department is doingThe law requires tenants to deduct TDS at 2% on rent above Rs 50,000 per month, in case the landlord is a resident Indian.

India offers to lower US farm tariffs, looks to strengthen trade ties: ReportIndia-US trade talk: The government has proposed reducing import duties on several US agricultural products, including almonds, walnuts, cranberries, pistachios, and lentils.

Why is stock market falling today? 3 things investors need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 339.66 points to 77,266.77 at 1:13 pm and the NSE Nifty50 traded 100.45 points lower to trade at 23,491.50. Here are three important points retail investors need to know.

India's billionaires have wealth bigger than Saudi Arabia's GDP. Check detailsIndia's billionaires now have a combined wealth that exceeds the entire economy of Saudi Arabia. India ranks third globally in the number of billionaires, behind the United States and China.

Health insurance rejected? Here are 5 things you need to knowUnderstanding why health insurance claims are rejected is important as it will help you avoid unnecessary stress or financial burden during medical emergencies.

How this scheme can help you save Rs 20 lakh in 15 years for daughterIf you are planning for your daughter's higher education expenses, the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) can be a great savings option.

entertainment.headline: Dupahiya 2: Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane and cast announce new season with fun videoAfter Dupahiya captivated audiences with its sharp humour and outstanding performances, Prime Video renewed the show for a second season.

I don't even sit on set: Salman Khan shuts down work ethic rumoursSalman Khan, in an interview with India Today, reflected on his work ethic and addressed rumours about him being late to shoots. The actor recalled his journey in cinema and said how disciplined he is.

Empuraan box office Day 2: Mohanlal, Prithviraj Sukumaran's film earns Rs 33 croreDirected by Prithviraj Sukumaran, L2: Empuraan earned Rs 33 crore in two days. Starring Mohanlal in the lead, the action thriller released in theatres on March 27.

Will Smith addresses Chris Rock Oscars slap in new albumWill Smith's latest album, Based on a True Story, dives into the controversy surrounding his Oscars slap incident. During Oscars 2022, Will slapped Chris Rock when the latter cracked a joke on Will's wife, Jada Pinkett-Smith.

Chris Brown announces 2025 Breezy Bowl XX tour: Dates, tickets & moreChris Brown announces his 2025 Breezy Bowl XX Stadium Tour, celebrating 20 years in music. The tour spans Europe and North America, with tickets expected to sell out fast.

Megan Fox vs. Machine Gun Kelly: Who has the higher net worth Megan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly welcomed a baby girl amid their turbulent relationship. With MGK's $25 million fortune exceeding Megan's $8 million net worth, his music and investments give him the financial edge.

The Family Man 3: Manoj Bajpayee confirms Jaideep Ahlawat in cast, November releaseManoj Bajpayee has confirmed Jaideep Ahlawat's inclusion in The Family Man 3. He also said that the show will premiere on Prime Video in November.

Maren Morris' new single 'carry me through' kicks off Dreamsicle eraCountry star Maren Morris unveils Carry Me Through, a soulful anthem from her upcoming album Dreamsicle. Set for release on May 9, it follows a year of personal and artistic reinvention.
Kanye West sued for unauthorised sample after refusing clearance over antisemitismGerman singer Alice Merton sues Kanye West for using her song Blindside without permission in Gun to My Head.

Vikram's Veera Dheera Sooran release delay not due to financial issues: ProducerVeera Dheera Sooran's producer addressed the release delay of the film. He wrote on X how it was not due to financial issues.

Avengers Doomsday: Marvel's bet on nostalgia or beginning of another end-game?Avengers Infinity Saga - Infinity War and Endgame - had huge impact on cinema when they released. But will the upcoming Avengers film - Avengers Doomsday - hold the same effect?

Shivangi Joshi sends love to boyfriend Kushal Tandon on his 40th birthdayOn actor Kushal Tandon's birthday, his girlfriend Shivangi Joshi showered him with love through a heartfelt wish. The actor turned 40 on March 28.

Ananya Panday as Dilreet Gill in Akshay Kumar's Kesari 2. Makers share new postersActor Ananya Panday has been officially announced as part of the cast for the upcoming Hindi film Kesari Chapter 2. On Friday, the makers unveiled brand-new posters featuring Panday to make the announcement.

Mad Square review: A wacky fun sequel, but lacks the magic of MadReleased-Fri Mar 28, 2025Even before its release, Mad Square promised a laughter-packed ride without logic or intricate storytelling. While it delivers fun moments and retains the quirky energy of its prequel, the film struggles with inconsistent humour, underdeveloped character arcs, and a stretched second half.

Adolescence through Jamie Miller's eyes: Highs and lows of a teenager's emotionsNetflix's critically acclaimed show, 'Adolescence' portrays the layers of adolescence through its celebrated lead actor, teenager - debutante Owen Cooper. We highlight the array of emotions that the show tries to explore via Jamie Miller.

Robinhood review: Nithiin-Sreeleela starrer commercial film lacks freshnessReleased-Fri Mar 28, 2025Robinhood film review: Directed by Chalo fame Venky Kudumula, Robinhood released in theatres on March 28, 2025. It is a tale of a street-smart thief and his antics to stop a drug-lord and save a village.

Ahead of Sikandar, a look at Salman Khan's last five films' box office performanceSalman Khan returns this Eid with the action-packed film Sikandar, directed by AR Murugadoss and co-starring Rashmika Mandanna. As anticipation builds, we take a look at the box office performances of his last five films.

Empuraan 1st day box office records: 5 historic benchmarks set by Mohanlal's filmMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's 'L2: Empuraan' is already rocking the box office. The film is yet to cover the first weekend, and it has set the cash registers ringing. Here's how.

The Glory to Weak Hero Class 1: Exploring bullying and its impact in K-dramasKorean dramas have been pivotal in showcasing the serious issue of bullying, exploring its effects on victims and society. Through powerful storytelling, these dramas address school violence, online harassment, and the emotional scars left behind.

general news.headline: Myanmar quake toll hits 694, India begins Operation Brahma to send aidAt least 694 people have been killed, according to a Myanmar military leader, with a US agency warning that the toll could exceed 10,000. Strong tremors were also felt in parts of India, including Meghalaya and Manipur, as well as in Bangladesh, particularly in Dhaka and Chattogram, and in China.

India-US tariffs will work out well, PM Modi is a very smart man: TrumpUS President Donald Trump reaffirmed his concerns over India's high tariffs while praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "great friend" and "very smart man".

US university cites 'academic freedom' amid row over Lived Hindu Religion courseVasant Bhatt, a political science major and Hindu-American activist, raised concerns about the course titled 'Lived Hindu Religion', complaining it was "Hinduphobic" and distorted "India's political landscape".

Elderly Karnataka couple dies by suicide after losing Rs 50 lakh to cyber fraudThe couple, both retired and formerly employed at the Maharashtra Mantralaya, did not inform anyone about the threats and extortion.

I don't even sit on set: Salman Khan shuts down work ethic rumoursSalman Khan, in an interview with India Today, reflected on his work ethic and addressed rumours about him being late to shoots. The actor recalled his journey in cinema and said how disciplined he is.

Haven't done a good job: JD Vance to Denmark amid Trump's Greenland buyout threatDuring a visit to Greenland for a few hours, US Vice President JD Vance scolded Denmark for "underinvesting" on the Arctic island, which the Scandinavian nation has owned for over 300 years.

16 Naxals killed in encounter with security forces in ChhattisgarhThe gunfight occurred as a joint team of security forces, comprising personnel from the District Reserve Guard (DRG) and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF), was out on an anti-Naxal operation.

CSK coaches don't have guts to ask MS Dhoni to bat higher: Manoj TiwaryManoj Tiwary slams CSK coaching staff for lacking courage to promote MS Dhoni up the order, as the star batter's late heroics proved too little, too late in their heavy defeat to RCB at Chepauk.

CSK vs RCB: MS Dhoni mania at Chepauk turns CSK fandom into cringefestIPL 2025: CSK's passionate fandom has morphed into blind Dhoni worship, with fans prioritising his presence over the team's success. Cheering his late entry at No. 9 in a lost cause in the game against RCB at Chepauk on Match 27 exposed a cringeworthy shift from cricketing sense to sheer idolisation.

Delhi government's job portals yielded just 2 jobs in 6 years, data revealsUntil 2020, Delhi had only one appointment portal. However, in July 2020, the government launched a second platform named the 'Rozgar Bazaar' portal.

Elon Musk's xAI startup buys his social media platform X for $33 billionThe all-stock deal announced on Friday combines two of Elon Musk's multiple portfolio companies, which also include automaker Tesla and SpaceX, and potentially eases Musk's ability to train his AI model known as Grok.

Woman's decomposed body found in Delhi flat, landlord detained: SourcesThe body of the woman, who lived with her husband in the flat, was found wrapped in a blanket and stuffed inside a bag, which was hidden in a bed inside the house.
What is 'brain flossing', and can it scientifically reduce stress?Ever heard of brain flossing? If yes, great, if not, we need some talking to do as it is trending.

Anamika Khanna's AK | OK show is a love letter to the white shirtThe humble white shirt - albeit not in its humble form - took centre stage in AK | OK's new collection, Silver Collar, displayed at the Lakme Fashion Week.

CEO gives 'school-style' punishment to employee for calling her by nameA CEO of a company allegedly forced a senior employee to write "I will not call you by your name" 100 times as punishment for addressing her without "Ma'am."

Trump administration moves to shut down USAID, fires remaining employeesThousands of USAID staff and Foreign Service officers assigned to the agency learned in an internal memo that all positions not required by law would be eliminated in July and September.

Family's quake horror atop swaying Bangkok high-rise as terrace pool overflowsA viral video captures a Korean family in a high-rise during Bangkok's tremors after Myanmar's earthquakes. Shaking rooftop pools created a waterfall illusion, amplifying panic before the family confirmed their safety.

Congress in Kerala praises Empuraan: World class film exposing Sangh agendaMohanlal-starrer Empuraan sparked discussions on social media after indirectly portraying incidents in connection with the Gujarat riots.

Probiotic supplements could ease autism symptoms in kids: StudyA new study has found that the gut-brain connection is an important factor in improving autism symptoms in children. It was found that probiotics can help manage autistic behaviour.

Isro successfully fires engine that will power India's heaviest launch vehicleIndia's space ambitions soared as Isro successfully conducted the first major hot test of its 200T thrust semi-cryogenic engine at IPRC, Mahendragiri, advancing future missions.

Did The Simpsons predict Trump's death? Show's producer debunks viral claimIn July 2024, after an assassination attempt on Trump, a doctored image emerged showing him in a coffin with the inscription "R.I.P Donald Trump 1946–2024."

No gangrape in RG Kar case, probing larger conspiracy: CBI to courtThe rape and murder of a trainee doctor at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College was not a gang rape but the act of a single perpetrator, Sanjay Roy, CBI informed the Calcutta High Court on Friday.

sports.headline: RCB captain Rajat Patidar leaves Phil Salt in awe: He's brilliant in all areasPhil Salt was in awe of RCB captain Rajat Patidar and said that the MP batter is brilliant in all areas of his game and has a good cricket brain. Patidar's fifty and his captaincy helped RCB secure a famous win at Chepauk on Friday, March 28.

MI head coach hopes fans move on from booing captain Hardik PandyaMumbai Indians coach Mahela Jayawardene has hoped that the fans would not boo Hardik Pandya, as they did in the 2024 season. Mumbai play Gujarat in Ahmedabad on Saturday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
